learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate positive professional relationships with clients, colleagues and the wider community, and the ability to adapt communication style for each target audience.
Demonstrate competency in giving clear and concise reports (both written and verbal) that are appropriate to the intended audience.
Demonstrate competency in evaluating relatively straightforward communication disorders, with respect to both formal and informal evaluation procedures.
Demonstrate competency in either describing or diagnosing the client's communication problem, and in using this information to plan and/or deliver a speech pathology management program.
Demonstrate a holistic approach to case management, through knowledge of contributing factors or clinical behaviours which may be affecting communication performance.

Demonstrate competency in all aspects of planning and implementation of therapy relating to the caseload seen at your clinical placement, particularly with respect to decision-making in clinical situations.
Demonstrate an appropriate level of professional, ethical and social behaviour in the clinical situation.

Evaluate your own performance and show a steady and gradual progression in your clinical development as well as understanding the role of this clinical course in your development of independent professional skills.
Demonstrate understanding of the role of other professionals and liaise with such professionals in the holistic management of clients presenting with communication and swallowing disorders.

assessments.due_date:
2/03/2026 - 6/03/2026

The midway evaluation will be scheduled at approximately the midway point of placement by your practice educator. Your educator will inform you of the date/time of your meeting and the date/time for which you need to complete your COMPASS(R) self-evaluation.
assessments.task_description: Your COMPASS(R) clinical evaluation will be completed with your practice educator at the midway point of your placement. Please ensure that you have completed self-evaluation using COMPASS(R) prior to your meeting with your practice educator at the midway point of your placement.
assessments.submission_guidelines: COMPASS®2 Online will be used for this placement course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.due_date:
23/03/2026 - 27/03/2026

The final evaluation will be scheduled at the end of your placement by your practice educator. Your educator will inform you of the date/time of your meeting and the date/time for which you need to complete your COMPASS(R) self-evaluation and ePortfolio submissions. Practice educators should complete their final evaluation of students using COMPASS Online within 1 week of placement conclusion.
assessments.task_description:
Students will be assessed at the end of the block placement using COMPASS®2 Online. Students are required to complete self-evaluation prior to their meeting with their practice educator. Practice educators should complete their final assessments for students 1 week after the completion of the placement.

At the conclusion of the placement, students are required to: 1) Submit their completed ePortfolio placement reflection; and 2) Submit their ePortfolio Clinical Showcase to their clinical educator.

Under no circumstances should identifiable clinical information be uploaded to open or external AI platforms, as it is unethical and irresponsible. Given this assessment is related to a placement with clinical information please see more information on use of AI in student placements under additional assessment information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: COMPASS®2 Online will be used for this placement course.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

learning_activities.topic:
Clinical Block Placement

Seven- week full time block placement in an external workplace clinic (paediatric, adult and/or mixed caseload), commencing 9th February, 2026.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08
